alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Western Hanover; Western King William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 5:39PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Caroline, northwestern Hanover and northwestern King William Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 539 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Montpelier, or 10 miles northwest of Randolph Macon College, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ashland, Beulahville, Mangohick, Dawn, Kings Dominion, Montpelier, Oliver, Gum Tree, Coatesville, Hewlett, Doswell, Etna Mills, Noel, Epworth, Calno, Gether, Burruss Corner, Globe, Pollards Corner and Duane Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central, north central and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Western Hanover; Western King William
